Package org.tweetyproject.arg.peaf.syntax

Class PEAFTheory

java.lang.Object
org.tweetyproject.arg.peaf.syntax.AbstractEAFTheory<PSupport>
org.tweetyproject.arg.peaf.syntax.PEAFTheory
Direct Known Subclasses:
NamedPEAFTheory
public class PEAFTheory extends AbstractEAFTheory<PSupport>
This class implements an abstract argumentation theory in the sense of Probabilistic Evidential Argumentation Frameworks (PrEAF).

See

Li, Hengfei. Probabilistic argumentation. 2015. PhD Thesis. Aberdeen University.
Author:
Taha Dogan Gunes

      Returns:

    • addSupport

      public void addSupport(int fromIndex, int toIndex, double cp)
      Add a support with indices for one to one mapping (fromIndex and toIndex)
      Parameters:
      fromIndex - the index of the argument originates the support
      toIndex - the index of the argument getting supported
      cp - the probability assigned to the support link (must be in range [0.0, 1.0])

    • addSupport

      public void addSupport(int[] fromIndices, int[] toIndices, double cp)
      Add a support with indices for many to many mapping
      Parameters:
      fromIndices - integer array with argument, represents indices of arguments
      toIndices - integer array with argument, represents indices of arguments
      cp - the probability assigned to the support link (must be in range [0.0, 1.0])

    • addAttack

      public void addAttack(int fromIndex, int toIndex)
      Add attack between arguments with indices
      Parameters:
      fromIndex - the index of the EArgument that originates the attack
      toIndex - the index of the EArgument that receieves the attack

    • getASCIITree

      public String getASCIITree()
      Returns an ascii tree for debug purposes. This is usually used in the unit tests.
      Returns:
      the ascii tree in string

    • printASCIITree

      public void printASCIITree()
